summary: This document is an email chain between Isidro Garcia, an attorney, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The emails discuss arranging a meeting with a female witness (whose name is redacted) for the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutors request the witness bring materials from her time with Epstein, including photos, phones, and gifts, to aid their investigation.

persons.name: Isidro Garcia
persons.context: An attorney from Garcia Law Firm, P.A., who is corresponding with SDNY prosecutors about arranging a meeting with a witness in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Mark Johnson
persons.context: Copied on the email chain between Isidro Garcia and the SDNY prosecutor, likely another legal professional or investigator involved in the coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the SDNY investigation. The witness is being asked about her recollections and materials from the time she knew him.

connections.description: Isidro Garcia is the attorney for a female witness being interviewed by the SDNY in the Epstein investigation, as he is coordinating the meeting and relaying requests to her.

The witness is being interviewed about her recollections of Epstein's conduct, and is asked to bring materials from the time she knew him, indicating she is a potential victim or witness to his actions.
Garcia and the prosecutor are corresponding to arrange an investigative interview with Garcia's client, demonstrating a professional, coordinating relationship.

events.title: Proposed SDNY Witness Interview
events.description: The SDNY prosecutors propose meeting with a witness and her attorney on May 29, 2019, to discuss her recollections of Jeffrey Epstein's conduct and to collect physical evidence from her.

events.title: Initial Coordination Call
events.description: A phone conversation occurred between Isidro Garcia and an SDNY prosecutor, followed by a summary email, to initiate planning for a witness interview in the Epstein investigation.

locations: 120 S. Olive Avenue Suite 401, West Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was actively pursuing witness interviews and physical evidence as of May 2019.
Prosecutors requested a witness bring personal items from her time with Epstein, including photos, phones, and gifts, to establish a record of her appearance and his conduct.
The correspondence shows careful protocol to avoid re-victimizing the witness while gathering crucial information for the investigation.
A key witness's name is redacted in the document, but she is represented by attorney Isidro Garcia.
